statements.name: PROC GKEYMAP
statements.description: The GKEYMAP procedure creates key maps and device maps that compensate for differences between the way that characters are encoded internally bySAS/GRAPH software and the way that they are encoded by different operating environments and output devices. † In addition, the GKEYMAP procedure can create SAS data sets from existing key maps and device maps, either Institute-supplied or user-generated. This capability is useful when you want to make minor alterations in a large key map or device map and you do not want to or cannot re-create the original data set with a DATA step. † The Institute supplies key maps for many keyboard configurations and operating-environment character representations. Your SAS Software Consultant should have selected the appropriate key map for your site. If the Institute-supplied device maps and key maps do not meet your needs, you can use this procedure to modify an existing map or create a new one.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Identifies the input data set for the GKEYMAP procedure. Used only when you are creating a key map or device map.

arguments.name: DEVICE=
arguments.description: Specifies the device driver that a device map is associated with, where device-name is the name of an entry in a device catalog. DEVICE= is not required when creating a device map, but it can be used if you want to limit the use of the device map to one particular driver. If you do not use DEVICE=, the device map can be used with any device. DEVICE= is valid only if you are creating a device map.

arguments.name: DEVMAP
arguments.description: Specifies whether you are working with a device map or a key map. The default is KEYMAP unless you use an option that can be used only with DEVMAP. This option also specifies the type of map you are outputting as a data set.

arguments.name: MULTFONT
arguments.description: Specifies that an alternate hardware character set is required to display one or more characters in the device map. Specify the MULTFONT option only when you create a device map.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Identifies the map that is to be created or converted to a SAS data set. Key maps are stored as map-name.KEYMAP, and device maps are stored as map-name.DEVMAP. The value of the KEYMAP or DEVMAP option determines the type of map and the extension added to map-name. It is possible to use the same map-name value for both a key map and a device map. If you create a key map or device map, the map is stored as an entry in the catalog GFONTn.FONTS where n is a number from 1 to 9, and you must use a LIBNAME statement to specify a libref for GFONTn.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: Identifies the output data set to which the data from a key map or device map are to be written. Used only when you output an existing key map or device map as a SAS data set.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Specifies whether you are mapping characters in a device map one-to-one or one-to-many.

arguments.name: MAP11
arguments.description: Each character in a graphics text string is mapped to only one character on the output device.

arguments.name: MAP1N
arguments.description: A single character in a graphics text string can be mapped to multiple characters on the output device.
